Common Pain Points

When Jobber Starts Holding You Back

Most contractors outgrow Jobber within their first year as they scale

Per-User Pricing Becomes Expensive

"Tiered per-user pricing becomes costly for larger teams"

Real user feedback. Per-user pricing "makes it a less scalable solution for growing businesses, particularly those with multiple employees who only need basic functions like clocking in."

"Pricing can be high for small businesses"

Costs climb quickly when upgrading for advanced features. Users report "high costs, required upgrades, and lack of pricing transparency."

Routing & Sync Limitations

"Limitations in mapping: only two route resets per day"

Real user complaint. "Can be frustrating for users reliant on this feature" as routes change throughout the day with cancellations and emergency calls.

"Google Calendar syncs every 24 hours, not real-time"

Users report this "creates time management issues" when technicians need up-to-the-minute schedule changes.

Limited Customization

"Cannot customize quote or invoice designs (fonts, colors)"

Common complaint from users. "Customization options, reporting, and integrations are limited" making it hard to match your brand.

"Payment processing slow, restrictive, difficult to customize"

Users report "refund and deposit limitations" and "no automatic credit card processing fee capability."

QuickBooks Sync Issues

"Syncing issues with QuickBooks flagged consistently"

Reviewers report this as a consistent drawback. Integration problems cause accounting headaches and manual reconciliation work.

"Can't create multi-day jobs"

"Jobber treats a $50,000 asphalt job the same as a $500 plumbing repair" - no support for complex, multi-day commercial projects.

Feature Comparison

Why Teams Switch from Jobber to Thorbis

Real problems, real solutions, real results

Flat Pricing vs Per-User Trap

The Jobber Pricing Problem

  • "Per-user pricing becomes costly for larger teams"

    Real user feedback. Costs $29-169/user/month depending on tier, making it "a less scalable solution for growing businesses"

  • "High costs and required upgrades"

    Users report having to upgrade tiers to access features, with "lack of pricing transparency"

  • Especially expensive for employees with limited access

    "Multiple employees who only need basic functions like clocking in" still require paid seats

The Thorbis Pricing Advantage

  • $200/month flat base fee with unlimited office users

    Add unlimited CSRs, dispatchers, managers, admins at no extra cost

  • Pay-as-you-go for actual usage

    Only pay for what you use: SMS, calls, AI features—no per-user seat charges

  • All features included from day one

    No tier upgrades needed, no feature paywalls, full access to everything

Bottom Line: Grow your team without growing your software costs
